content.description: Starts on same 2 low crimps as So Dope, moves up to match on sloper, and then straight up face.  Given V8 originally, some new beta makes it some easier.  Ian's original beta is still very hard.
content.location: The face to the left of the finish of Massive Vertigo.  See photo.

content.description: Sit start low with slopey crimps, bump up to sloper and toss out right to good edge near sloper on Massive Vertigo.  Stay tight and gain small crimp, top-out same as MV.
content.location: This problem starts low on face a couple feet left of the finish of Massive Vertigo.  The start crimps are maybe 3 feet directly left of the large sloper that is end of the hard climbing on MV (see photo).

content.description: Start on large ledge near left corner, climb up corner to gain good face holds.  Top-out on slopers and some ok in-cuts.     Starting on lower crimps makes it a bit harder, maybe V2/3, but it's not as fun.
content.protection: Pads.  Good flat landing has been built up, but watch out for the small tree.
content.location: Up hill and left of Massive Vertigo.

content.description:
Start on the crimp rail towards the bottom of the pit and climb up and left to the sloper on the arete.  Go up from here. 

  Ed:  Originally given V8, new/easier beta has been found (see below-- sweaty's video is him doing the original V8).
content.protection: Pads and spotters.  Not a perfect landing.
content.location: This boulder sits on the left side of the talus field about 75 yards up from the lake.

content.description: Starting the same as Massive Vertigo and then head right. This line will take you straight up the boulder but over terrible landing that is hard to protect.
A big bloc, in the woods
